result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan A Borovkoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 130 DAYS time served.
Court allows transfer of probation to Nevada.

miscConds.notes:
- Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 
- No possession of firearms.
- Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. Court advise defendant that if expungement is granted, defendant can never possess a firearm.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Cognitive Behavioral Intervention program.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
- Anger Management Counseling
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan A Borovkoff

defendant.name: Borovkoff, Logan A
defendant.address: 337 North Macy Street, Fond Du Lac, WI 54935

records.addlTxt: Invoice dated 8/29/2022 forwarded 9/19/22 for approval to supervisor in the amount of $656.25 to Dr. Deborah Collins, Psy. D. for services on 08/03/2022, 08/17/2022, 08/18/2022.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction, filed.

Defendant Logan A Borovkoff in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Logan A Borovkoff.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a court trial. Parties do not contest findings, which state that there is no evidence the defendant suffered from a mental disease or defect on the date of the offense.  There is also no data that he lacked substantial capacity to understand the wrongfulness of his acts.  Defense wishes to proceed with plea/sentencing.
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the information.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1:  Court ordered Defendant to serve 1 year in the House of Correction, with credit for 130 DAYS time served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 years.

Conditions of Probation:
- Court allows transfer of probation to Nevada.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Provide a DNA sample
- No possession of firearms.
- Cognitive Behavioral Intervention program.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
- Complete 40 hours of community service.
- Anger Management Counseling
- Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 6 months. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. Court advise defendant that if expungement is granted, defendant can never possess a firearm.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief, 20 day appeal rights given.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 

Filed:
- Pretrial Incarceration Credit
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records and Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Logan A Borovkoff not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a return on doctors report. Doctor filed a letter requesting additional time. Court requires doctors report to be filed 2 weeks prior to next hearing. Case is adjourned.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Court trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Dr. Collins Request for Extension; filed.
Order for Examination under 971.16, Wis. Stats, filed.
Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court.   All conditions remain the same.

Defense submitted a Jury Trial Waiver form. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived right to jury trial. Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. Collins be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.16.

Defendant Logan A Borovkoff in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Logan A Borovkoff in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.   Original Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Logan A Borovkoff not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for an Arraignment.  Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourne, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Logan A Borovkoff in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appear by video.  Defendant Logan A Borovkoff in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Deputy B. Shayhorn.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense request a arraignment. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Arraignment scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Logan A Borovkoff in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Logan A Borovkoff in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Logan A Borovkoff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
